path: /Users/arpithaprakash/Capstone/1-2CR CONOPS&DRAWs - Copy/39/20240724 Landnav CONOP LANDNAV WEST.pptx

sections.MISSION: Mustang Troop, 2CR conducts dismounted land navigation at Land Nav West NLT 13AUG24 IOT build solders confidence on their individual land navigation skills and prepare them for E2B
sections.PURPOSE: of this operation is to build and test soldiers' confidence on their ability to navigate three out of four points in under three hours through various terrain, simultaneously setting conditions for E2B.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Leadership identify 5x group leaders(NCO’s)​ to conduct land navigation skill class
OIC and RSO print enough score cards and maps for 60x candidates
Conduct orientation and safety brief
Range is completed with no loss of equipment or injury to soldiers
sections.END STATE:
All Soldiers execute a day and night iteration un-assisted
Training Objectives
Map reading orientation, identify marginal information, symbols and terrain features.
Use of navigation tools, employ compass to find azimuths and protractor for plotting points
Plan routes and use terrain association
Dead reconning using compass and pace count to navigate without visual landmarks
Execute day and night land navigation under varying light conditions
Resourcing
OIC: 1LT Milauskas, John RSO: SSG Baskeyfield
CLS DRV (FMTV): HHT79 PFC Burrell CLS: 68W’s On-site
Billeting: Bivouac/ Lite Fighter tents Chow: A / M / A
Supply: Request 60x Compasses and 60x protractors
Uniform: FLC with Camelback (at least 3 liters), gloves, eye pro, map marker, pen, pencil, poncho, compass, protractor, red lens, zip lock bag
POC: 1LT Milauskas, John; john.r.milauskas.mil@army.mil
COA: 1200 08AUG 2024
